parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and the base of duno; to cause to sink out of, i.e. to divest.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To place or put around, clothe; fig: I bestow, confer. From peri and tithemi; to place around; by implication, to present.
Crimson, scarlet, dyed with Kermes (coccum), the female coccus of the Kermes oak. From kokkos; crimson-colored.
A short cloak, worn by military officers and soldiers. Of uncertain derivation; a military cloak.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
